title.value: Unsupervised Concept Discovery Mitigates Spurious Correlations
title.justification: The title of the paper is explicitly stated at the beginning and end of the content provided.
title.quote: Unsupervised Concept Discovery Mitigates Spurious Correlations

extractions.description: The paper presents a novel framework that leverages unsupervised concept discovery to reduce spurious correlations in training of deep learning models. It focuses on object-centric representation learning to infer and manage concepts within datasets, thereby enhancing model robustness without requiring human annotation for subgroup labels. The introduced method, Concept Balancing Technique (CoBalT), is evaluated on benchmark datasets like Waterbirds, CelebA, and ImageNet-9, demonstrating improved handling of subpopulation shifts without labeled data.

type.justification: The paper involves evaluations and comparisons of the proposed method against baseline methods on various real-world datasets.
type.quote: Evaluation across the Waterbirds, CelebA and ImageNet-9 benchmark datasets for subpopulation shifts demonstrate superior or competitive performance compared state-of-the-art baselines, without the need for group annotation.

name.justification: The paper is fundamentally centered around improving learning models by mitigating spurious correlations using unsupervised learning techniques.
name.quote: This paper demonstrates the use of object-centric representation learning approaches to design classifiers robust to spurious correlations without the need for human-labeled subgroup annotations.

name.justification: The paper emphasizes the use of unsupervised learning techniques for concept discovery and mitigating spurious correlations in datasets.
name.quote: In this paper, we establish a novel connection between unsupervised object-centric learning and mitigation of spurious correlations.

name.justification: The research involves image datasets and addresses challenges like attribute generalization and recognition under varied conditions, which are typical concerns in computer vision.
name.quote: Evaluation across the Waterbirds, CelebA and ImageNet-9 benchmark datasets for subpopulation shifts demonstrate superior or competitive performance compared state-of-the-art baselines, without the need for group annotation.

name.justification: The aim is to make models robust to spurious correlations, which is a key aspect of robust model design in deep learning.
name.quote: This paper demonstrates the use of object-centric representation learning approaches to design classifiers robust to spurious correlations without the need for human-labeled subgroup annotations.

name.justification: The model introduced in the paper to mitigate spurious correlations through concept discovery and balancing is named CoBalT.
name.quote: We introduce CoBalT: a concept balancing technique that effectively mitigates spurious correlations without requiring human labeling of subgroups.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced and developed within the scope of this paper as a core contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce CoBalT: a concept balancing technique that effectively mitigates spurious correlations without requiring human labeling of subgroups.

is_executed.justification: The paper evaluates the model across several datasets, indicating it was executed for empirical testing.
is_executed.quote: Evaluation across the Waterbirds, CelebA and ImageNet-9 benchmark datasets for subpopulation shifts demonstrate superior or competitive performance.

is_compared.justification: CoBalT's performance is compared to other models and techniques at handling dataset shifts and mitigating spurious correlations.
is_compared.quote: demonstrate superior or competitive performance compared state-of-the-art baselines

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Learning Face Attributes in the Wild
referenced_paper_title.justification: CelebA dataset is commonly referenced with this default paper by Liu et al. 2015.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The CelebA dataset presents a notable class imbalance between gender attributes (male/female) and hair color (dark/blonde).

name.justification: PyTorch is explicitly mentioned as the library used for implementing ResNet-50, the model backbone in experiments.
name.quote: We train the concept discovery and classification model using ResNet50 (He et al., 2016) pre-trained on ImageNet from the Pytorch library (Paszke et al., 2019).
